interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: High Anxiety
Review Date: 2019/07/19
Categories: Suspense, Comedy, Anxious, Campy
Product Description: ['Mel Brooks is a psychiatrist with a fear of heights in this hilarious spoof of classic Hitchcock thrillers.']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mel Brooks'], 'Producers': ['Mel Brooks'], 'Starring': ['Mel Brooks', 'Madeline Kahn', 'Cloris Leachman']}
Review Text: I just believe this one is especially brilliant, clever, and funny.
Review Title: Mel Brooks = national treasure!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

The Suspicions Of Mr. Whicher: The Murder At Road Hill House Suspense, Drama, Emotional, Serious ['Inspector Jack Whicher is part of the newly formed Scotland Yard detective department and travels to Rode, Wiltshire, to investigate a murder at a country house. With no material evidence and only an inept local police force to help, he faces the unenviable task of solving a case in which members of the grieving family are the main suspects.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Hawes'], 'Producers': ['Nigel Marchant', 'Robert Bullock'], 'Starring': ['Paddy Considine', 'Peter Capaldi', 'Alexandra Roach']} I really enjoy these episodes. The costumes, sets, lighting, and plot twists are all well done. Five Stars {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Frances McDormand', 'Richard Jenkins', 'Bill Murray']} It was worth watching. I enjoyed watching the actors develop the characters, the sets, costumes, and the lovely areas where they filmed. Worth the long haul Britannia Drama, Historical, Fantasy, Action ['The mysterious and tumultuous land of 43AD Britannia is occupied by many warring tribes, until the invasion of a foreign army sparks chaos and allegiances. Celtic rivals Kerra (Kelly Reilly) and Antedia (Zoë Wanamaker) must face the oncoming Roman invasion led by Aulus Plautius (David Morrissey) as it seeks to dismantle the Celtic Resistance.'] {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['CHRISTOPH SCHREWE'], 'Producers': ['VERTIGO FILMS', 'NEAL STREET PRODUCTIONS'], 'Starring': ['DAVID MORRISSEY', 'KELLY REILLY', 'NIKOLAJ LIE KAAS']} I kept getting recommendations to watch this, and I honestly thought it was going to low budget and semi comedic spoof based on the production still. I never read video reviews, before watching because I don't want spoilers, and they are always so distorted in a way that is inaccurate, unfair, misleading, or simply not helpful to me. I very much enjoyed this story-line, and once again I was glad I hadn’t read negative reviews before watching. I only started reading after watching the season to determine if there will be more to come. As for history, I wouldn't ever get my facts from a show to write a research paper. Productions like this are driven by people who want it to do well and hook viewers. These types of shows are loosely based on history, and I appreciate the effort to add a bit of historical precision to adaptations. I'm not looking for a history lesson, I want entertainment. History buffs should go make their own movie --then complain about another’s. I love how critics claim ownership of historical “facts” like they have a Tardis and were actually there at the time. I dream of an internet where people would FIRST make their own movie or whatever product they go online to malign. Then I might respect their opinion when comparing products. I'd enjoy seeing how people type about their work compared with another work. Perhaps they would not be so quick to judge, because they would better appreciate and fully understand why decisions are made. Alas, all the expertise they deem worthy is having a keyboard, an internet connection, and a presumption. If you look, you'll find MOST critics haven't actually written historical works of their own, nor have they ever made their own product, movie, or show about anything they claim to be such experts on. If they were truly erudite and passionate, you would have made their own adaptations by now. So glad I finally watched this and did not read the negative reviews! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Kristen Bell', 'Ted Danson', 'William Jackson Harper'], 'Studio': ['NBC']} I like the writing in the show, but I sure wish each episode was double the runtime. 20 minutes goes by too fast! I'm sure it makes it easier on the cast and production to do these type of short episodes though, so as long as they keep making the show I'll be happy. Enjoyable to follow {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Kenny Florian', 'Chris Rose']} This seasons episodes are great and I love the extras! WOW! What an exciting season! High Anxiety Suspense, Comedy, Anxious, Campy ['Mel Brooks is a psychiatrist with a fear of heights in this hilarious spoof of classic Hitchcock thrillers.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mel Brooks'], 'Producers': ['Mel Brooks'], 'Starring': ['Mel Brooks', 'Madeline Kahn', 'Cloris Leachman']} I just believe this one is especially brilliant, clever, and funny. Mel Brooks = national treasure!
profile:
**User Summary:**

This user prioritizes family-friendly programming suitable for all ages and consistently favors engaging mystery series, lighthearted content, and comedies. Their recent positive interaction with a historical drama underscores their appreciation for well-crafted storytelling, strong character development, and immersive narratives across diverse genres. They enjoy intricate plots and character dynamics that align with their discerning aesthetic taste.

The user’s affinity for educational content remains strong, particularly in engineering and innovation, reflecting a desire for exciting and informative narratives. Notably, they have expressed a preference for longer episodes, highlighting their desire for depth and engagement in storytelling. Their openness to darker themes remains contingent on high production values and a balance of humor with quality storytelling.

The latest interaction highlights their admiration for clever and comedic narratives, reaffirming their enjoyment of films that blend suspense with humor. They maintain a critical perspective on reviews, favoring compelling storytelling over strict historical accuracy in adaptations, and enjoy creatively interpreted narratives. Overall, their profile reflects a rich appreciation for an eclectic blend of genres, including comedies, mysteries, and dramas, all required to engage, entertain, and provide intriguing visual elements, while being accessible through English audio and subtitles.
